gematria_values.description: Represents the singular point of creation, divinity, and the infinite in the finite.
Means 'life'. Commonly used in the custom of giving monetary gifts in multiples of 18.
The numerical value of the Tetragrammaton, the ineffable name of God.
Means 'heart'. Significant in Kabbalistic literature, associated with the 32 Paths of Wisdom.
Represents transition or change, such as the duration of the Great Flood or Moses' time leading the Israelites.
Associated with the 72 names of God in Kabbalah, derived from three verses in Exodus 14.
Significant in Jewish contexts and also known as the Fine Structure Constant in physics.
Represents the total number of mitzvot (commandments) in the Torah.
While most associated with Christian eschatology, it appears in the Hebrew Bible in contexts like 1 Kings 10:14.
The gematria value of the word 'Mashiach' (Messiah) when spelled in a particular way.
